availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Bazel Hall (Powell County, Kentucky, convict in the Kentucky State Penitentiary)

body.p: Powell County, Kentucky, convict in the Kentucky State Penitentiary. Powell County native. Son of Henry W. Hall and Lucinda Hall. Resident of Powell County, Kentucky, in 1850. Resident of Powell County in 1860. Convicted of forgery in Madison County in June 1860. Imprisoned in the Kentucky State Penitentiary in Frankfort from June 1860 to January 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Montgomery County, District 2, p. 53B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Powell County, p. 20.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Powell County, Precinct 2, p. 144B.
Missouri Death Certificates, 1910-1969, Missouri Office of the Secretary of State, Jefferson City, MO, File 24099.
"Bazzel Duke Hall (1847-1925)," Find A Grave, Memorial 95923180, accessed June 11, 2017, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/95923180.
KYR-0001-029-0570.
